metadata.name: Vim GTFOBin Abuse - Linux
metadata.comment: Detects the use of "vim" and it's siblings commands to execute a shell or proxy commands. Such behavior may be associated with privilege escalation, unauthorized command execution, or to break out from restricted environments.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/rvim')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/vim')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/vimdiff'))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' --cmd')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -c '))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(':!/')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(':lua ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(':py ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/bash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/dash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/fish')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/sh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/zsh'))))

output.summary: Detects the use of "vim" and it's siblings commands to execute a shell or proxy commands. Such behavior may be associated with privilege escalation, unauthorized command execution, or to break out from restricted environments.
